DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE: Studying samples of tissue from patients with cancer the in laboratory may help doctors identify and learn more about biomarkers related to cancer. PURPOSE: This research study is studying biomarkers in tissue samples from young patients with acute myeloid leukemia.
DOC.brief_title: Biomarkers in Tissue Samples From Young Patients With Acute Myeloid Leukemia
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES: - To determine whether the pattern of global and TSG-specific promoter CpG island hypermethylation and gene silencing that we have shown characterizes MLL-rearranged (MLL-r) infant bilineage ALL is also characteristic of other subsets of MLL-r leukemia. OUTLINE: Previously collected cryopreserved cells from diagnosis are analyzed for promoter methylation via HELP arrays, gene expression arrays, and RT-qPCR. PROJECTED ACCRUAL: A total of 32 samples (8 from each of 4 biologically defined cohorts) will be analyzed.
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS: Available cryopreserved cells from diagnosis At least 2 x 10^7 viably cryopreserved cells One of the following biologically defined cytogenetics/molecular cohorts: t(9;11) t(11;19) Other 11q23 translocations Normal cytogenetics PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS: Not specified PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY: Not specified
DOC.keyword: childhood acute myeloid leukemia in remission
untreated childhood acute myeloid leukemia and other myeloid malignancies
